item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "A clerk and a ladder and warm golden light, and then: the right book exactly, at exactly the right time." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Your life must be an open city, with all sorts of ways to wander in." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Walking the stacks in a library, dragging your fingers across the spines -- it's hard not to feel the presence of sleeping spirits." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "There is no immortality that is not built on friendship and work done with care. All the secrets in the world worth knowing are hiding in plain sight." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I am haunted by humans." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Ken Grimwood
item.description: "The only thing that mattered was that the quarter century or so he had remaining would be his life, to live out as he chose and in his own best interests. Nothing took precedence over that: not work, not friendships, not relationships with women. Those were all components of his life, and valuable ones, but they did not define it or control it. That was up to him, and him alone." -- Ken Grimwood

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Margery Williams Bianco
item.description: "You become. It takes a long time. That’s why it doesn’t happen often to people who break easily, or have sharp edges, or who have to be carefully kept. Generally, by the time you are Real, most of your hair has been loved off, and your eyes drop out and you get loose in your joints and very shabby. But these things don’t matter at all, because once you are Real you can’t be ugly, except to people who don’t understand." -- Margery Williams Bianco

item.title: Rhonda add a quote by Margery Williams
item.description: "Weeks passed, and the little Rabbit grew very old and shabby, but the Boy loved him just as much. He loved him so hard that he loved all his whiskers off, and the pink lining to his ears turned grey, and his brown spots faded. He even began to lose his shape, and he scarcely looked like a rabbit any more, except to the Boy. To him he was always beautiful, and that was all that the little Rabbit cared about. He didn't mind how he looked to other people, because the nursery magic had made him Real, and when you are Real shabbiness doesn't matter." -- Margery Williams
